availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Michael H. Owsley (Lincoln County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Joel Owsley and Mary Owsley. Married to Ellen Letcher Owsley. Student in Cumberland County in 1850. Attorney in Cumberland County in 1860. Served in the 1st Regiment Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as captain in 1861. Served in the 5th Regiment Kentucky Cavalry as major from March 31, 1862, to September 5, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burksville, p. 279B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burksville, p. 659.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster District 3, p. 432B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 34-35 and 108-09.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 940.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0009.
